dt: {bc}to seize and take away by violence
{bc}to overcome with emotion (such as joy or delight)

et: Middle English {it}ravisshen{/it} "to seize forcefully, plunder, carry away, carry off (a woman) in order to sexually assault her, seize as prey, carry up (into heaven), enrapture, sweep along," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}raviss-,{/it} stem of {it}ravir{/it} (also continental Old & Middle French), going back to Vulgar Latin {it}*rapīre,{/it} re-formation of Latin {it}rapere{/it} "to seize and carry off, take away by force, carry off a woman with the intent of sexually assaulting her, carry or sweep along, impel forcibly (to a course of conduct), snatch up, gather quickly" {ma}{mat|rapid:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to seize and take away by violence
to overcome with emotion (such as joy or delight)
